Issues.Title: Propagate bindings on ViewModel of UserControl
Issues.Body:
I have a UserControl that uses a ViewModel.  I want to be able to set a property on the ViewModel of the control and have the value propagate via bindings up to the ViewModel of the host page:

	<MainWindow DataContext="{Binding MainWindowViewModel}">
		<MyControl ViewModel="{Binding MyControlViewModel}" SelectedTabIndex="{Binding SelectedTabIndex}" />
	</MainWindow>


Both `MainWindowViewModel` and `MyControlViewModel` have a `SelectedTabIndex` property.  I want to change that property in a private method on `MyControlViewModel` and let the binding change in on `MainWindowViewModel`.


I created a very simple [working test harness](https://github.com/JenWilson82653/TabTest) that demonstrates the problem.

The only related question I could find on StackOverflow is [this one](https://stackoverflow.com/questions/22247633/binding-usercontrol-dependency-property-and-mvvm) which in my opinion does not provide a very useful answer (or perhaps I just don't understand it).
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Propagate bindings on ViewModel of UserControl" (#2596)

Issues.Title: WPF .netcoreapp3.1 win-x86 app cannot load net35 x86 dll.
Issues.Body:
* .NET Core Version: 3.1.1

![MicrosoftTeams-image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/4112014/74690517-46f5f780-5244-11ea-8ab7-08d1db7c6b98.png)

* Does the bug reproduce also in WPF for .NET Framework 4.8?: Could not try, as depecency to netstandard 2.1

 **Problem description:**

WPF .netcoreapp3.1 win-x86 app cannot load net35 x86 dll. When Process is AMD A6-9225
 
 **Actual behavior:** 

Throws

Could not load file or assembly 'CefSharp, Version=1.25.0.25466, Culture=neutral, PublicKeyToken=null'. An attempt was made to load a program with an incorrect format.
 
 **Expected behavior:**
 
Load the dll without any issue
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "WPF .netcoreapp3.1 win-x86 app cannot load net35 x86 dll." (#2597)

Issues.Title: How to freeze last column in WPF datagrid ?
Issues.Body: I need to freeze last column of the WPF datagrid. When I set the FrozenColumnCount as 1, then it will freeze only leftmost column but I need to freeze right most column. (that means I need to prevent column from moving). How to achieve this? Seems like need to write custom extension. But I don't have any idea of how to do that? Any guidance or advice will be much appreciated!
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "How to freeze last column in WPF datagrid ?" (#2591)

Issues.Title: Use theme to create DocumentGridPage borders
Issues.Body:
Does what the title says. The border/shadow can now be customized by creating a style with the key `{ComponentResourceKey TypeInTargetAssembly={x:Type FrameworkElement}, ResourceId=DocumentGridPageContainerWithBorder}` at whatever scope you desire. The default value for this style is a copy of the current, manually constructed border. [Here is a zipped demo project](https://github.com/dotnet/wpf/files/4201467/DocumentViewerTest.zip); note that you'll have to change the WpfRepoRoot variable in `DocumentViewerTest.csproj` before building.

I also took the opportunity to rewrite `ThemeGenerator.nativeproj`. It is now stripped of all MS-internal-isms and can be run with MSBuild directly to regenerate the XAML files in the theme projects.

Fixes #1518.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "Use theme to create DocumentGridPage borders" (#2574)
